results.title: Swinging the broom
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Hall, Andrew Wiseman and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An elderly street sweeper, who has grown tired of his supposedly nagging wife, seeks relief from her by meeting the young woman he sees on his cleaning round. Ending up badly beaten, after his intentions have been misunderstood by one of the women, he arrives home to discover a caring wife. They make up and his misguided ways appear over. But are they?

results.title: Swing away
results.creator_credit: Max Glandbard, Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Golfer Tommy Armour demonstrates the importance of coordinated balance, rhythm, and timing in the backswing and the downswing. Shows the advantage of the closed stance for the drive and other long wood shots and of the square stance for long iron shots. Discusses the specific uses of various golf clubs. Includes demonstrations in slow motion photography.

results.title: Swing and sing
results.brief_description: A collection of big band jazz music with classic songs “The Boogie Woogieman”, “Dancing on air” and “Fantasia” which eventually set the popular tunes and rhythms in 1950s United States. Featuring Will Osborne and his Orchestra, Martha Tilton - Brian Sisters and the Aida Broadbent Dancers.

results.title: Swimming in the primary school
results.creator_credit: Derek Monk and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
This film studies swimming lessons with junior children showing three levels: a class of beginners; a mixed-ability class; and a class in which all the children can swim and are working to make their strokes more efficient and to build up stamina.
Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description: Swimming is about the tug of the tide. In an effort to make sense out of the confusion, 12 year old Lee Johnson decides to make a movie of her life using her Dad’s home video camera. She confronts the sticky question of her identity and searches for answers in the cobwebbed corners of domesticity. Some things, it seems, are better left alone. She finds herself drawn, inevitably, towards an unwanted ending.

results.title: Swim and live
results.creator_credit: Syd Wood, Frank Killian and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the progressive steps in learning to swim and how a life can be lost by not being able to swim. Illustrates different swimming styles and shows a championship swimming event. Features Olympic champion Murray Rose.

results.title: SWIFT website (22-05-2000)
results.brief_description: 1998 Project description: Cinemedia is currently developing a tailored solution for the storage and delivery of film and video titles in a digital environment. When SWIFT is operational, it will be used to provide online delivery of Cinemedia’s screen culture programs. It will also offer commercial digital management and delivery services to owners and users of audio-visual material.
results.description: 1998 Project description: Cinemedia is currently developing a tailored solution for the storage and delivery of film and video titles in a digital environment. When SWIFT is operational, it will be used to provide online delivery of Cinemedia’s screen culture programs. It will also offer commercial digital management and delivery services to owners and users of audio-visual material.

results.title: Swift and sure
results.brief_description: This film shows some of the vast array of modern communication equipment and training of the Royal Australian Signals’ Personnel who operate and maintain it. A signal message from Papua is shown passing through various processes of transmission en route to Canberra.
